Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in the hotel late and night and since the check in counter is closed you check in through the Astor next door. The staff here were really friendly and more than happy to point us in the right direction for food etc. The room was I think the bext out of 10 hotels we stayed in durning our trip, the ceilings were really high which made the room feel bigger. The room was super clean and we heard no outside noise at all. The two double beds were comfortable and there was even a couple of wing chairs and a table. We meet friends who were also travelling through the statesand ther where staying at the Holiday Inn accross the road. They paid more than us and were very jelious of out room. At least it felt more local than the standard Holiday Inn. I would 100% stay here again next time I was in town. Everything was within walking distance and the staff were great with resturant and tour reccomendations. We paid $70US a night which I thought was a great price for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best 40th Birthday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to New Orleans for a a few days to celebrate my 40th birthday. Seriously drained from the long flight, we arrived at the Alexa Hotel at around 9:00am. We were greeted with a warm smile by Raquel Williams. I expected that we'd have to check our bags and just waste a couple hours walking around, before checking in in the afternoon. Instead, Raquel said she'd be glad to let us have a room early, if there was any available. I didn't even have to ask! I have to say, her personality made our stay even more pleasant! I didn't even tell her it was my birthday and she wrote a warm birthday wish on a little card. She also gave us great advice on where to eat and gave great directions. Not only was the service great and the rooms nice, we also loved the location of the hotel. The hotel is located just outside the French Quarter, so it's not too rowdy. It's walking distance to everything, right around the corner from Acme Restaurant, walking distance to Harrahs, great shops and the ferry. It's in front of one of the main streetcar lines that leads to the waterfront or uptown. We know where we're going to stay the next time we're in New Orleans, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laportecadillac
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 days and 3 nights at the alexa hotel and would recomend it to anyone looking for a reasonable priced room close to everything. Located at Canal and Bourbon st it is right on top of all the action. The only draw back is the same as almost any hotel in the area parking is limited and exspensive. We paid almost $100 to park for 4 days. Overall the hotel was nice and clean. The reasturant in the hotel "the Bourbon House" was excellent and reasonably price for dinner for 2 with 2 apiteizers we paid $46. Overall when ever we get back to new orleans we know where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “ok all in all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Mother as a gift for my sister and I for our January birthdays, paid for our trip to NO and our stay at the Alexa Hotel. The descriptions online of the hotel give it way more justice than it deserves and arriving at the front door of the hotel (which is in a watery, stinky alley way) was a little worrysome. We were "greeted" by the front office staff to check in and were told that we needed to put down a deposit of over 100.00 never mentioned anywhere else or to my Mother BEFORE we could check in> I didn't understand but we were tired and wanted into our room so we agreed on a tight budget and gave the $$ over. The staff is definately NOT friendly in any way and unfortunately I got the distinct impression it was a racial issue over the course of our stay. Our room was acceptable and we quickly learned the attached hotel had a much friendlier staff and nicer entrance so we used that to come and go-bellhops were awesome! It is a fabulous location and despite the staff we had a great time. I do have to say that there was one gal in particular that brought us room service our first night who was really nice and told us some great places to check out and also gave us a ton of safety tips and we really enjoyed her the 5 minutes she was in our room! We ordered room servcie one night and the guy who delivered it didn't know how to deal with a credit card order. He hand wrote my card number down and didn't give me a reciept but said everything would be taken care of. At checkout time we were told we owed money for that same room service order and that they had no record of me ever giving a credit card number and said it had been "charged" to my room. It took over an hour to resolve the situation with me raising my voice and asking where the employee was with my credit card number in hand! An employee from the kitchen remembered the situation and brought about friendly resolve but I can definately say that if we ever return to NO we will definately find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It served the purpose. Liked the location.”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend in NOLA and stayed at the ALexa. This hotel is really the bare bones sister of the adjoining hotel, the Astor. WHen we arrived, Wednesday evening, there were 2 clerks at the desk discussing their dinner orders. They were pleasant, but spent more time talking to each other than taking care of our checking in. There was no bellhop to speak of, but we didn't have a problem with that. Our room was on the 4th fl. facing Canal St. It was on the dark side, but I don't think as dark as those facing the inner courtyard. The room was a decent size (we had 2 queen beds for a family of 4). There were definitely signs of wear and tear, but there was also an attempt at charm and it was clean. Overall it was nicer than a Holiday Inn, but not as nice as a Marriott. We did have a problem with the TV remote and one of the phones. We also requested extra pillows. They did respond rather quickly to these situations. There was one day when I put out the 'Maid Service Please' sign when we left in the morning, when we returned at 3:30, the room still wasn't cleaned. We called and also told the front desk as we went out again. They finally did come and clean at that point. The location can't be beat, and it was quiet at night. The Bourbon House restaurant, located in the adjoining Astor hotel was very nice for dinner, but a disappointment for breakfast (walk the 2 blocks to the Marriott for a great breakfast buffet). We had no problem getting a late checkout (actually not all that late, 1pm, but better than 11), they also arranged for a taxi back to the airport, and held our luggage for a few hours after we did check out. We didn't have a problem with dark scarey corridors when we came and went through the Astor lobby. If you get a good deal, and are looking for a place that 'serves the purpose', the ALexa is fine. If you are looking for elegance, and lots of amenities you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “March Visit to Aleax”
Reviews.Author: Bexleyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. The room was small by US standards and although clean the bottom of the bath looked grubby. There was manypeople staying for a convention and the we were worken by people shoulting each night between 2 and 4 am. People were playing ball in the corriders although when told about this security did go and speak to the people concerned. We found the staff polite and helpful. The adjoining Plaza hotel seemed much better. Thee room was very dark and looked over the back of other buildings. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “yuck - disappointing in all ways”
Reviews.Author: Freethinnker
Reviews.Content: We stay in New Orleans regularly for business and pleasure, so we are familiar with many of the hotels in the city. We stayed at the Alexa in the fall of last year for our first and last time. The staff was extremely unpleasant and rude. They seemed very put out to even speak to use upon check in. Even the bellhop was sullen and silent. Our room was small, dark, and cheaply furnished and decorated with broken handles, chipped floor tiles, peeling wallpaper, etc. We were unable to purchase movies or games via television due to some problem with their system, which was disappointing for our children, since it was rainy and we had promised them some games. The Alexa shares a lobby with another hotel and you have to meander through very narrow hallways and it is dark and creepy. I do not recommend this hotel to families, or anyone for that matter. There are many other fine hotels that are similarly priced and much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good size room but dark”
Reviews.Author: TL59
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Mardi Gras at the Alexa. The room was large and clean, but it was one of the darkest rooms I ever stayed at, as it faced a small second floor courtyard and neighboring room windows. The desk staff was very pleasant and the cleaning staff were efficient, but did not seem to want to clean the room unless they had to. Twice, the cleaning woman asked us if we just wanted towels or was cleaning required. I know it was Mardi Gras and they wanted to party, but we were paying the average of $275 a day for this place, and at least wanted the beds made. On the second night of our stay, we had a couple next door who came in at 5 AM, made very noisy love, threw a party for several people who slammed the door with every entrance, then had a big screaming fight. The walls are thin, so it all sounded like they were in our room. I just got up and tried to read through it. A few hours later, security, to their credit, did come and they were asked to leave the hotel. The location is excellent. Several of the really good restaurants are doors away. A big deli, though sort of honky tonk in atmosphere, is just next door. If the room had had a little light and air, it would have been just great.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL room-great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the location of this hotel but the room we had sucked! I had stayed here before and had a beautiful room so when I called for Papa Noel rate in December, I assumed it would be the same type of room- I was very wrong. The room that we got was the size of a postage stamp.I had to move the desk chair into the doorway of the bathroom just to be able to get in & out of the bed. This room would have been a great walk-in closet!

Reviews.Title: “Simply average”
Reviews.Author: y2flu
Reviews.Content: Good location, but there's a lot of construction going on down on Canal Street and at least for the present time, I wouldn't recommend staying here. Rooftop pool is a nice bonus. Rooms were OK, but nothing special. Unless you can get a really good deal on a room (like $79 or less), I wouldn't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Could Ask For, And a Little Bit More”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Alexa over Christmas. Unfortunately the airline lost my luggage. I asked for a robe from housekeeping and they brought us two within half an hour, which we were not charged for. Our room was quite big and bright with almost floor to ceiling windows overlooking Canal Street. The location is excellent - we were able to replace our lost toiletry items Christmas Eve at the Walgreens across the street and I was able to get a t-shirt from the souvenir shop next door. My only complaint is that we only had one glass upon arrival, when I requested the robe I also requested an extra glass. They brought two, but the next day housekeeping removed them and we only had one glass again. We were lucky enough to find the glasses sitting outside the door, so washed them out and hid them in the closet for the rest of our stay! I would highly recommend the Alexa and would stay again. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellant location! Can walk to almost anything. We went for a football game, and then partied on Bourbon Street. The room was small, but perfect for what we needed. Very clean and the staff couldn't have been any nicer. Would not stay anywhere else when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexa for 6 nights over Halloween. The location is great Canal, Royal, & of course Bourbon are at your fingertips. Very easy to get to the St Charles streetcar, right across Canal street. We arrived in the morning, left our bags and then were called on our cell phones when a room was available round 2pm instead of the regular 4PM check-in. The staff is terrific. Very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “a good value”
Reviews.Author: wendigo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent three nights at the Alexa for Halloween weekend. We checked in on the Astor Crowne Plaza side and stayed on the Alexa side. We were able to pull right in front of the hotel on Canal Street to drop off the car with the valet and get assistance with our bags. The Astor front desk had no problem checking us in there, and the bellman led us to our room on the Alexa side. Our room was directly over Royal Street on the third floor. The bellman called the Alexa "the quiet side." They assigned us to a handicapped-accessible room, which was much larger than a standard room. (We had friends staying in the Alexa as well and their room was smaller/narrower but still very nice). Our room had a huge window overlooking Royal Street, which was interesting. The room was clean and nice, although basic. We had plenty of toiletries and towels. We found all of the staff to be very helpful. There were three entrances/exits -- on Canal, on Bourbon (through the restaurant) and on Royal through the Alexa lobby. Our room was right by the elevator down to the Alexa lobby (which I worried about at first but was not a problem and actually nicely convenient). I did find it a little odd to travel through a maze of corridors and elevators to get from one side of the hotel to the other, to use the gym, pool or visit the restaurant, but it was not a big deal. The only potential problem involves the valet parking, which is located off-site from the hotel. If you need your car during your stay, you have to take a hotel shuttle to the parking deck, which is located several blocks away. We did not need to do this, as we prefer to take a cab if we're going far afield, but it could be time-consuming and inconvenient. Also, upon checkout, you do have to load your luggage onto the shuttle (with the help of a bellman -- and tip him) then tip the shuttle driver, then have another bellman unload the luggage again and load it in the car, another tip! Plus the wait for the shuttle to get there, everyone to load up that needs a ride to their car, etc. I'd suggest checking out at the last minute or off-peak time. We were told check-out could take up to 45 minutes due to waiting on the shuttle, but we didn't have any trouble since we checked out right at noon and left the hotel around 12:15.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read some pretty bad reviews about this hotel and I thought it was pretty decent. I read some reviews about the walls being too thin and being able to hear the hallways from your room. I heard nothing!!. We just got back we went halloween weekend. The location is great Canal, Royal, & of course Bourbon are at your fingertips. Very easy to get to the St Charles streetcar, right across Canal street. Beds are comfortable, bathroom small but everything was there, nice water pressure, I found the staff to be friendly, you have to go to the crowne astor though for concierge services. All & all I would stay there again, especially if you want easy acess to Bourbon where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Rossy-D
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Alexa. The hotel is in the best location. We walked everywhere. We were on the 4th floor on Canal Street and found it a little noisy at night, however, it never kept us awake. All in all a great place to stay. We would definitely stay at the Alexa again if we ever have the opportunity to travel to New Orleans in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic internet rate, and our room was absolutely huge compared to the one where our friends were staying at the Monteleone. We found the staff to be quite pleasant, and the location was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel! The one very small negative...I had prepaid the entire reservation and I see on my credit card that I was billed $2.00 by the hotel. Not a big deal, of course, but we had no incidental charges so I trust that they will take care of that immediately (and if not, I'll be back to let you know!). Overall, though, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived in NO August 26th and stayed 4 days in celebration of my 22nd birthday. The convenience of using the Astor Hotel is definitley a plus. We entered and exited the Astor from Bourbon Street the whole trip (except of course after 11pm when the doors are locked). The location is fabulous, it's right in the center of the party and near all attractions. The beds are super confortable and the rooms are decent. The only complaint I have is the pool. It's very small and dirty and looks a lot better in the picture. However that small setback didn't ruin our vacation at all, we found plenty of other things to do in the four days we were there. I highly recommend Dickie Brennans Steakhouse, it was the best steak I've tasted so far and the setting is very romantic (beware of the 10 hostesses that pop up at your table every 2 minutes...haha- you'll know what I'm talking about when you go) Hope this review helped and have fun in the Big Easy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents a great value if you don't need to be pampered. The lobby is very basic (unlike alot of other New Orleans boutique hotels), and there are no extra facilities (gym, pool, dining) actually in the hotel, although it is part of the Astor and you have complete access to their facilities (with no need to go outside). My room assignment concerned me at first: It was the first room just off the main elevators. While my room had a entry hallway, if the AC was off you could hear everyone waiting for the elevators. On the plus side, the room was spacious, again compared to other botique hotels but...and I liked this but some might not...the room was alot like a manhattan loft apartment. It had exposed brick walls, very large windows (and despite being on the fourth level you could hear the street noise at night until after 2am), and exposed pipes on the high ceiling. It was definately not like the typical hotel room, but it did have character. The rate I received was VERY good, especially for a weekend (expedia). The woman who checked me in was very friendly. Location is convenient to everything. In room safe and coffee maker, good cable channel selection, and bed was VERY comfortable (I like firm). I only had one issue with a housekeeping staffmember which, while surprising, was relatively minor and apparently not hotel policy. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Alexa thru ---------- for 3 nights total price with tax $212.10. I had a fairly large room with 2 queen beds. Very clean and up to date. The Alexa is shared with another hotel called the Crown Plaza. At the main entrance on Canal street enter the Crown Plaza doors, the front desk is for both. I did use the vallet parking at $20 a day which your car is taken to a overhead parking 6 blocks away. I recomend to use this service, one less worry to have. You pull up on your first day arrival and the bell hop will grab your bags while some else parks your car. When ever you need your car go to the front outside entrance they will radio your car # to the parking deck. You will hop on small bus shuttle (no charge) and you will be taken to garage where your car will be waiting. This whole process takes about 15 minutes. The hotel is on the first block of Bourbon Street where all the stores, bars & clubs begin at. There will be a few people that will be returning back late to their rooms that had way to much to drink (to loud). The hotel is close to allot of activities, all within walking distance (Super Dome, casino's, river boats, french market, fish aquarium, imax theater, lots of good restaurants and the famous Cafe Du Monde for those tasty Beignet"s (french donuts). The hotel is right off of Interstate 10 (less than 10 minutes), Exit 235B go south on Canal the hotel will be on your left side. If I ever go back to New Orleans I will stay at the Alexa Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please pick this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans last weekend I got there late about 1030pm had no problem checking in hotel is beautiful it is a part of the crown plaza hotel the room was immaculant our room was gold and white the comforter and sheets were white I have never been to a hotel with a white comforter all marble bathroom cd player in the room 2 phones ans 2 phone lines I will definitely for the price book here again it is right on Bourbon street the parking per day is $19.99p tax but worth it. Check out ws hectic so I opted for a late check out which they had no problem with it is right across the street from foot locker the childrens place ashley stewart payless and many other shops feel free to e mail me if you have any questions about the hotel or anything in new orleans!!!!!! Take someone you love and enjoy there is alot of walking involved in order to see everything so ladies pack some comfortable shoes and clothes check pat o brien's on bourbon street and get a souvenir glass they are nice gifts!

Reviews.Title: “The Alexa was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about coming to stay at the Alexa because the room was only $63 a night. That is the cheapest I have ever paid to stay in the Quarter. I have stayed in probably 10 different hotels within the French Quarter and the stay at the Alexa was a one of the best experiences I have had when staying in this area. If any of you know the area, it is almost impossible to stay in the Quarter and find a room where it is quiet. I mean there is nothing but 24/7 partying going on. It is hard to expect silence. The rooms were nice and clean, as were the bathrooms. The shower head rocked. The water was on a filtration system. I know this because Louisiana water is not very good at all and this water was fine. The beds were perfectly comfortable. I did not like the feathered pillows but some people do. After calling room service they immediatley came to our room (after midnight) with more pillows (even though they were booked solid) The hotel used to be a warehouse so they have really tall ceilings. The one thing in the rooms that will drive you crazy is that there air conditioners in the rooms shut off when there is no movement. So, after being gone for a while expect a warm room. I loved that the hotel connected with the Astor Crown Plaza. That gave us three entrances (Royal St, Bourbun St and Canal St) You can't beat the convenience for the price. The front desk staff at the Plaza was not very helpful but the valet service was (that is who you park your car with). They also had complimentary luggage storage, which is great when you want to continue having a good time in the Quarter but it is time to check out.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel in the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Alexa for a convention at the Morial Convention Center. Upon arrival I was greeted and treated very well. All staff were friendly and easy to talk to. The rooms are exceptionally clean. I have stayed at many hotels, and I was totally impressed by this one. The high ceilings, the beautiful furniture, the bathroom. All were top notch. I did not have time to visit the pool but I did meet someone in the elevator that enjoyed it very much. Room service was quick and yummy. 3 entrances. The one on Bourbon closes early. Nice walk to Convention Center - about 1/2 hour. If I should ever come to New Orleans again, I will definately stay at The Alexa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Bring you EARPHONES!”
Reviews.Author: bebeluna
Reviews.Content: The room was Great! it was super clean and nice.Location also Great. The only thing i did not like was that i would hear the other rooms conversation! Other than that i had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Orleans twice each year for the last 8 years or so and been lucky enough to stay at the cream of the crop each time. I am very surprised to have heard any negative reviews about this hotel. Before visiting I assumed that this came from people just not being use to going to New Orleans-it's not a clean place you know. I just assumed that they would be okay rooms, but after seeing exactly what it was I have no idea what they are speaking of. Evidently, they are accustom to staying in $500.00 a night rooms with a butler. I hope I'm lucky enough to stay here again in August for the same price I'll be able to blow another couple of hundreds. The two hotels are the same you can check into either one. One looks high class the other is just simple. All staff is very friendly rooms are very nice and clean with down comforters. Location is perfect at the top of Bourbon on Canal - there are 3 different entrances. Take my word stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: JeffandBron
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I rated this place highly - great location near Bourbon Street, large rooms with high ceilings, big comfortable beds, and a helpful staff (they couldn't give us a room immediately upon arrival, but called us on the cell the instant that one was available). Room rates were definitely reasonable for what we got, and we would stay at the Alexa again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're the independent type”
Reviews.Author: Smarlen
Reviews.Content: If you can get a good rate and need no particular assistance, the Alexa is a great hotel in a convenient (but not particularly quaint) French Quarter location. If you need help with your bags, someone to change a lightbulb in your room the first time you ask, or a well-made bed, you should go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Alexa. The room was clean and larger than I was lead to believe from previous reviews. The only negative aspect was there was no view at all, only a brick wall. The staff were very helpful, and the location is fantastic. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travellers to NOLA, when we saw that the Alexa had mixed reviews we werea bit hesitant. However. the staff was incredibly attentive,although the pool/spa/health club is located in their sister hotel the Crowne Plaze it is located w/on the same building a short walk and an eleavator ride away, the location is ideal (Canal & Bourbon), rooms are spacious and neat, valet servic prompt. We stayed an additional day, making almost a week simply because we were so pleased w/ the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alexa April 1 - April 6 (NOT for the Women's Final Four), for vacation. Traveled with another party staying at the Crown Plaza next door. We had a much lower price then they had in their hotel, with similar rooms and being able to use the same facilities. Very convenient being able to exit the hotel on any of the three streets, exited on Royal when getting breakfast or going shopping, exited on Canal when going uptown, and exited on Bourbon when going out for the evening. The room our companions had in the Plaza was slightly larger, but ours had beautiful 12 foot ceilings and massive windows overlooking Canal. We had only two minor complaints about the whole trip. The first is that upon arrival, there were no rooms available as we had requested. We were early for check in anyway, so we left our bags with the front desk, and got lunch. The second complaint is that it is kind of a maze to get from one hotel to the other. If we were to visit our companions in the ajoining hotel, we had to walk down a half flight of stairs, take the elevator down, walk through the Crown Plaza's lobby, and finally ride their elevator up to their floor. I cannot comment on the helpfulness of the staff, as we were all experienced with travel to New Orleans, and two of us had lived there in the past. Overall, we were very happy with the room and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend at the alexa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very noisey.They need to post signs in hallways to reming other people and their maids to be considerate of guests that may be sleeping. we had a baby with us and needless to say, after the third day, we were exhausted. Hotel staff should already have this courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience trying to get a decient rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the Alexa, but have read the reviews. After reading the review "BRING YOUR MOUSE TRAP", that took the cake. I called to make reservations, and was quoted three different room rates. Could not understand the difference in price from 1 month ago. I was quoted $199.95 and 1 month ago the room rates were $89.00. How rediculous is that? After I kept asking for a lower rate I was finely quoted $169.15 still high. Same rate of the Crowne Plaza. And I think thats where I will stay. This visit is not for pleasure but death.

Reviews.Title: “e really enjoyed our stay, very friendly staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexa March 4t, 5th and left on the 6th and had a wonderful stay. The staff were freindly and helpful with everything from unloading our luggage to directions on places we were looking for. Our room was clean and we asked for extra pillows and recieved them within minutes. Our next trip to New Orleans we will definitely stay at the Alexa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mardi Gras Location!”
Reviews.Author: oluis78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexa during Mardi Gras (Feb 20-23). Location Location Location. The Alexa is the same as the Crown Plaza. I actually checked in and out at the Crown Plaza. There are three entrances to the Hotel. One is on Royal Street (great if your trying to get around the Bourban Street crowds). One is on Canal Street (the parades go right in front of this entrance). And the third is on Bourban Street. it is the beginning of Bourban Street. Stumpling back to the room after a night on Bourban Street was very easy and safe! Harrah's Casino is a 5 min walk (4 blocks) Highly recommend due to it's great location!

Reviews.Title: “Alexa okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexa in January '04 with my fiance for a long weekend in New Orleans. The price was right ($80/night) for my budget, and the location looked good. As someone who has lived in a college dorm sometime in the past 5 years, I had no problem with the somewhat dirty bathroom, filthy windows, and general "Super 8" feel of the place. However, the front desk staff could not have been ruder if they tried. Well, maybe rude isn't the right word... perhaps "aloof" would be better. They were no help whatsoever with anything. However, if you're looking for a *decent* place to stay that won't cost an arm and a leg, the Alexa would be great. I would stay there again, just with somewhat tempered expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I blindly booked a room here in January 04. I didn't know much about New Orleans, much less what to see. We were just passing through. When I realized I was half a block from the famous Bourbon Street, I was ecstatic! For $89 + tax, I didn't have to drive after partying all night! The room and hotel was nice and clean. The staff was pretty stoic, but I didn't really need much attention. Give me my room and let me rest. I wasn't there to be waited on. Parking was valet only. I feel more comfortable parking my own car.

Reviews.Title: “Better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after i booked the room and got nervous after reading some of the reviews. but everything went well and better than i expected. the location and price were good too

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Crankee
Reviews.Content: I'm giving the Alexa an above average rating because of the rate as was given. I took all reviews into consideration when I made my reservation. After a one night stay at the rate of $59, I have no complaints. I will say that this is not a service-oriented hotel. There's a doorman and a front desk person. The doorman was busy helping another guest when I arrived so I had to get my bag from the curb to the lobby. No big deal, in my opinion. If you are seeking a full-service hotel, do not reserve the Alexa. My room was charming and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 12/04/03...rooms were not ready but the staff was very accomodating in finding us other smoke-free rooms adjacent to one another. The rooms were narrow but very clean. The beds were very comfortable with the blankets having a top and bottom sheet protecting them...thus making it more sanitary. A staff person would knock every afternoon asking if the room had been cleaned to our approval. Every morning the New York Times was outside our door. The location was great with entrances on Royal, Canal and Bourbon, making it easily accessible when returning at night from being out on the town! Another great feature was having the Alexa and the Crown Plaza connecting...meeting up with our party in the Crown Plaza lobby because it was the larger of the two. We'd definitely stay at the Alexa again and have already referred it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Use this site to find a better place. The staff are rude, the hotel is below average.

Reviews.Title: “Alexa Hotel and Staff were Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from New Orleans and had a great experience at the Alexa Hotel. Our room was clean and larger than expected, although the walls were a bit thin (or the neighbors too loud). The staff were wonderful from beginning to end. They helped find a parking spot for some friends that were with me for a brief visit. And they accommodated a request for a late check-out without any problem. They were super diligent about making sure my taxi was on time to get me to the airport, which left me totally worry-free. Most important to me was the great attitude all the employees had that I ran into during the course of the day. All the small courtesies like genuine smiles and asking "how are you doing today?" really made an impression.

Reviews.Title: “UNSKILLED AND UNHELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A comedy of errors all round. From the head concierge to the desk staff to the room service staff, I have never seen a more unwilling, unhelpful and lazy group of workers in my life. I would never stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Alexa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 119 Royal Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
